definition: to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
completely unreasonable

sentences.english: All the employees resigned as the boss is bing unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲老闆太不講理，僱員全體辭職。

sentences.english: You'd better reason things out with him calmly.
sentences.chinese: 你最好心平氣和地同他講理。

sentences.english: All employer quit because boss is so no unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲老闆太不講理，僱員全體辭職。

sentences.english: As Mr. Lee is pigheaded, I can't reason with him.
sentences.chinese: 李先生頭腦頑固，我無法與他講理。

sentences.english: The teammates were so unreasonable that he left the football team.
sentences.chinese: 隊友太不講理了，故此他離開足球隊。

sentences.english: He is a calm and reasonable man.
sentences.chinese: 他是個心平氣和而講理的人。

sentences.english: You also need to think about when and if you can reason with an assailant.
sentences.chinese: 你也得考慮何時以及是否可以跟侵犯者講理。

sentences.english: All the employees resign because the employer is too unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲老闆太不講理，僱員全體辭職。

sentences.english: Because the boss was too unreasonable, all employees resigned.
sentences.chinese: 因爲老闆太不講理，僱員全體辭職。

sentences.english: Liars of terrible devotion, caverns of virgins, ferocious places.
sentences.chinese: 殘忍的苦行窟，處女們的火坑，蠻不講理的地方。

sentences.english: All the staff members quitted because of the extremely reckless boss.
sentences.chinese: 因爲老闆太不講理，僱員全體辭職。

sentences.english: Trying to reason with him only enrages him even more.
sentences.chinese: 跟他講理只會使他更加生氣。

sentences.english: The whole family are irrational, don't deal with them any more.
sentences.chinese: 瞧這一家人都不講理，你別去招惹他們了。

sentences.english: At no time did I feel they were being unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 我從沒覺得他們不講理。

sentences.english: It is no use arguing with the people who won't see reason.
sentences.chinese: 與不講理的人爭論毫無用處。

definition: to reason/to argue logically
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to contradict (elders or superiors)
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
plain/clear/obvious
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to bear grudges
